title: Brexit deal vote result: How your MP voted on Boris Johnson's deal and implementation timetable
text:
MPs have voted to proceed with turning Boris Johnson's Brexit deal into legislation, but rejected the Prime Minister's timetable for doing so, casting the whole process into doubt.

Parliament backed Mr Johnson's renegotiated deal in the second reading of the Withdrawal Agreement Bill this evening by 329 votes to 299, with the Government's majority relying on expelled Conservative and Leave-backing Labour MPs.

Although the Bill cleared its crucial first hurdle - a major success given Theresa May's failure to get MPs to back her deal - MPs then voted against Mr Johnson's accelerated timetable for enshrining it in law, making a Brexit delay a near necessity.

The Government's fast-tracked timetable...
description: MPs have voted to proceed with turning Boris Johnson's Brexit deal into legislation, but rejected the Prime Minister's timetable for doing so, casting the whole process into doubt.
